file_name: SLOVAKWIRELESSFINANCECOBV_03_28_2001-EX-4.(B)(II).3-Maintenance and support contract for SICAP(R) modules.txt

perturbation.original_text: Prices are subject to yearly adjustments. Sicap Ltd may send a new offer.       The offer shall be sent two month prior to the beginning of the dedicated       next year.
perturbation.changed_text: Prices are subject to yearly adjustments at Sicap Ltd's discretion. Sicap Ltd may send a new offer. The offer shall be sent one week prior to the beginning of the dedicated next year.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract stated that price adjustment offers should be sent two months before the new year. The modified version shortens this period to one week, potentially violating contract law principles that require reasonable notice for significant changes like price adjustments.

perturbation.original_text: All payments due under this Maintenance and Support contract shall be due       and payable 30 days after the invoice date, with the first invoice to be       issued on the date this Maintenance and Support contract comes into full       force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: All payments due under this Maintenance and Support contract shall be due and payable 60 days after the invoice date, with the first invoice to be issued on the date this Maintenance and Support contract comes into full force and effect.
perturbation.explanation: The payment period has been extended to 60 days. This conflicts with standard business practices. While not explicitly illegal, excessively long payment terms without justification can create financial strain and potentially be challenged under unfair business practice laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness and Good Faith

perturbation.original_text: After the initial period of two years, the maintenance and support       contract shall be automatically renewed for a period of one year on each       renewal date, unless one of the parties terminates the maintenance and       support contract through written notification to the other party in the       form of a registered letter with proof of receipt, at least six (6) weeks       prior to the renewal date.
perturbation.changed_text: After the initial period of two years, the maintenance and support contract shall be automatically renewed for a period of one year on each renewal date, unless one of the parties terminates the maintenance and support contract through verbal notification to the other party, at least one (1) week prior to the renewal date.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'written notification' to 'verbal notification' and the reduction of the notice period from six weeks to one week introduces significant legal issues. Verbal notifications are difficult to prove, creating enforceability problems. The shortened notice period may be deemed unreasonable, potentially conflicting with contract law principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Notice Requirements and Enforceability
